definition: internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together

sentences.english: In the book Lenin gave a profound analysis of the struggle inside the Party.
sentences.chinese: 在這本書裏，列寧深入地分析了黨內鬥爭。

sentences.english: Chinese fast food enterprises skillful infighting continues.
sentences.chinese: 中式快餐企業真功夫的內鬥還在繼續。

sentences.english: Morale was down. The division managers fought each other.
sentences.chinese: 公司員工士氣低落，部門經理間內鬥不斷。

sentences.english: In particular, Wang and Sun Hongbin of infighting , but also is lovely planning.
sentences.chinese: 特別是，王和孫宏斌的內鬥，而且是可愛的規劃。

sentences.english: What are the lessons which have been derived from these two inner-Party struggles?
sentences.chinese: 這兩次黨內鬥爭所得的教訓在什麼地方呢？

definition: to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to force the king or emperor to abdicate
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
